title: [Large-Scale] Neonatal Resuscitation Simulation Training Program

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental neonatal life support (NLS) theory and clinical experience
context.additional_context: Simulation-based training for practicing medical professionals to enhance practical competencies, utilizing Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) for data recording and analysis

learning_goals: Learners perform standard protocols (initial assessment, airway maintenance, breathing support) with 90% accuracy in a neonatal resuscitation simulation scenario.
In team-based emergency situations, learners reduce decision-making time by 30% and clarify role distribution.

During a two-week CPR training course, learners self-assess their responsibility (5-point scale) and emotional regulation (5-point scale) weekly. In a final three-page report, they analyze how personality traits affected CPR performance using three specific examples (e.g., maintaining compression depth, team communication).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
